articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's air force said on Monday it shot down six out of eight Russian-launched drones and two out of three missiles during an overnight attack over four Ukrainian regions.
articles.title: Ukraine says it downed six drones and two missiles during Russia's attack

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Typhoon Yagi and the landslides and floods it triggered have killed at least 24 people and injured another 299 in northern Vietnam on the weekend, the government said, as authorities on Monday warned of more flooding.
articles.title: Vietnam's death toll from Typhoon Yagi rises to 24, govt says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 14 people were killed late on Sunday in multiple Israeli strikes targeting the vicinity of Masyaf, a city in Syria's Hama province, Syria's state news agency reported on Monday.
articles.title: Israeli strikes on Syria kill at least 14 people, Syrian state media say

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: The U.N. human rights chief said on Monday that ending the nearly year-long war in Gaza is a priority and he asked countries to act on what he called Israel's "blatant disregard" for international law in the occupied Palestinian territories.
articles.title: UN rights chief calls on states to challenge Israel over occupation

articles.author: Christopher Bing, Katie Paul, Raphael Satter
articles.description: Russia is increasingly turning to American social media stars to covertly influence voters ahead of the 2024 presidential election, according to U.S. officials and recently unveiled criminal charges.
articles.title: Russia focusing on American social media stars to covertly influence voters

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least six people died after a boat capsized off Senegal over the weekend, a spokesperson for the West African country's armed forces said on Monday.
articles.title: At least six dead after boat carrying migrants sinks off Senegal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 31 people have been killed and 100 wounded since the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces renewed an assault on the city of Sennar in southeastern Sudan on Sunday, a legal activist group said.
articles.title: RSF paramilitaries kill 31 in Sudanese city of Sennar, activists say

articles.author: Riham Alkousaa
articles.description: German police practices foster systemic discrimination, with officers routinely engaging in racial profiling and relying on ethnic stereotypes, according to a study published on Monday by an online portal that tracks data on immigration and asylum.
articles.title: German police methods foster bias, racial profiling, finds study

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Polish security services have neutralised a sabotage operation orchestrated by Russia and Belarus that aimed to destabilise Poland, Deputy Prime Minister Krzysztof Gawkowski said on Monday.
articles.title: Poland neutralises sabotage group linked to Belarus and Russia

articles.author: Sakshi Dayal
articles.description: India's Supreme Court ordered all doctors protesting over the rape and murder of a female medic last month to resume work by Tuesday, warning they may face "adverse action" if they failed to adhere to the deadline.
articles.title: India's top court orders protesting doctors to resume work by Tuesday
